bug.summary: minio-pv,mysql-pv bound but looking for gce-pd storage
bug.description: AttachVolume.NewAttacher failed for volume "minio-pv" : Failed to get GCE GCECloudProvider with error <nil> On-prem, all-in-one install using a fresh built kfctl (0.6-ish) using platform="minikube" and components="k8s". Obviously, no public cloud storage attached. Shouldn't these just make use of a default StorageClass?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pdmack>@pdmack</denchmark-link> I believe the config files for minikube are out-of-date and contain gcp-specific options. It should be possible to deploy Kubeflow on Minikube using platform <denchmark-link:https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/#Kubeflow-for-Existing-Clusters---by-Arrikto>existing_arrikto</denchmark-link> . Just make sure to have a LoadBalancer available, using the command.
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> but what do we mean by a LoadBalancer in this context and why would it be required?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pdmack>@pdmack</denchmark-link> it is required to expose the Istio Gateway with standard ports. I am working on lifting this requirement, but it exists for now.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pdmack>@pdmack</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/johnugeorge>@johnugeorge</denchmark-link> has a PR pending <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/website/pull/977>kubeflow/website#977</denchmark-link> that will update the instructions for installing on an existing cluster. <denchmark-link:https://deploy-preview-977--competent-brattain-de2d6d.netlify.com/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>https://deploy-preview-977--competent-brattain-de2d6d.netlify.com/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/</denchmark-link>
I think those instructions should work with minikube and not require an LB. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pdmack>@pdmack</denchmark-link> Can you provide links to the instructions/code etc... that you were following so we can file bugs to clean them up?
